values:
Yep just finished work... I shall be brief as my next task is to go home... The one bit of my day that i semi-enjoy...
Ack! It has been a bad one, printer trouble and silly people asking silly things, dumbasses.
On a more positive note i do get to go home and try and record magical things into fruity loops... Home my sound card copes ok....

My prep for 2006 is starting here by the way... no details as yet as if it all goes tits up i don't want people pointing and laughing at yet another failure to keep to self imposed restrictions. christ i hope all is work is gonna be worth it....

So you may well ask why im not getting an early night then... simply because i have to be over-knackered to be able to sleep in this heat.
not much is happening of note in my life. Welcome back Joey BTW!
erm... oh yeah on the 29th there is a thing at the Hayward Gallery (Waterloo) at wich logic bomb is playing. as it finishes quite early (about 9) i though t it could be followed by clubbage. Any interested get in touch by any means.
As my life is soo uneventful im gonna stop now

Felt very, very strange today as everyone may well have guessed. Most of you probably did too... 
Read an evening standard at the earliest possible opportunity (as i was walking from Hackney to Walthamstow in pursuit of a bus... about 6 miles in 75 minutes) and was stunned by the picture of the bus (sounds like you experienced it all Mark, glad you are alright :-) ), I was however appalled by most of the reports which appeared to be little more than an attempt to dramatize an exceptionally shocking incident. Last I heard on the radio was that 37 were confirmed dead in 4 explosions across town (however both numbers are still fluctuating slightly) thoughts go out to those affected.

My own personal story as ever in these sort of times seems less than relevant, however I hope my opinion of these events is noteworthy. I will NOT be cowering away from my life as normal, and will NOT be intimidated by such behaviour. Indeed I have heard that Logic Bomb (of micromusic fame) may be playing a set tomorrow uptown, which if it is going ahead i will be attending (sorry i havent invited people but i still dont know any details).

I also went to see Jack Dee tonight btw. He was quite good, though due to circumstances only 350 of a 3500 crowd showed up, it seemed quite eriee (sp?) and i felt a little sorry for him as it was for the DVD of the tour (often meant to be the highlight), oh well what can you do eh?

Hello everyone how are you? oh thats the purpose of this site... i geddit....
spent the last 20 minutes trawling through 2 weeks of entries, ack.
Phone is buggered, people are awkward and money is low. 
Roll on July... Roll on...

Arrrgh!!! Just 10 minutes i would have considered myself in a miserable mood, now i feel bouyant as anything... This is getting purely riddick.
On the old positives going to see MCR in November, that will be fun, even if i have to be careful of trampling teenage girls all night!
er.... Yeah going to BBQ in Wandsworth today, sounds nice... hope the weather holds. Dammit i feel soooo old for some reason. 
Someone shake me by the shoulders and remind me that im happy!

Well that was a dismal attempt at posting tomorrow...
Busy, Busy, Busy...
ARRRGGGHHHH!!!!
can't say its not fun though, even though my old irrational mood has been going up and down like a flimsy yo-yo. i think fragmented is the word.
Good things a go-go eh?
erm i seem to have said a lot without saying anything, ah well...

A return to the brief update, i will try and post in force tomorrow :)

1. What made you happy this week?
Being active for 5 consecutive days!!! Finding out i was moving into designing (on top of the rest!!) at work, getting paid, getting a new phone, my first 2 star grade on ITG which i saved a screenshot on my new USB memory card, Having Nadia officialy be my girlfriend (W00T!!!)

2. What made you sad?
Not being able to help people i think i should

3. What made you angry?
Nothing that i recall too well, im sure Colin or Laurence (at work) said something dumb

4. What are you looking forward to in the next week?
Enjoying many many things of fun. and trying not to be indoors

5. What are you not looking forward to?
Being indoors when i cant help it

Ahhh... Slipknot, like the good old days.
I though i'd do a long update today so im actually sitting in my room at the moment typing into notepad, gonna port all this using an old school floppy disc (now so obsolete that computer stores dont always offer them as standard, i mean who doesn't use CD-R's these days?).

Right firstly a slightly more in depth of the weekend. During the day me and Richard headed off to Highbury (where Arsenal play football) to see if we could find a pub that was screening the FA cup final, of course most of them were. Most of them were also full! Luckily we bumped into a (fellow?) Arsenal fan who seemed to know of a slightly more isolated pub that we could get to before the game kicked off.
In short it was excellent, the fans were loud without being destrctive, although the level of anti-spurs chants was worrying, i had to keep checking to make sure i hadn't accidentally worn a Tottenham shirt out of the house by mistake! The penalty shoot out was as tense as anything and the reaction to Jens Lehmanns save from Paul Scholes was unbelieveable.
Then the obligatory DDR (wel ITG) session, glad to say my shin has healed up quite well, its now just a case of getting my accuraycy back to the level it was prior to my injury.

I arrived at House Wandsworth far later than i expected, but i had gone via covent garden tescos to acquire some super noodles, and entered the sitting room to the joy that was the Norweigan Eurovision entry, of course i was hooked immediately, especially by the accompanying drinking game that led us through the evening ("shes changed her dress, drink!!!") and ,me through a whole bottle of ginger wine.

The following day was one of chillage exellente, and my introduction to the world of hacky-sack, im still not sure how its possible to get your various appendages to keep the little bag of sand off the ground, and Matt and Mark's excellent demonstrations left me somewhat bewildered... The day also included listening to Kate Bush songs with Joey and Dean, finding 'my chemical romance' aren't as bad as i previously thought, watching the start of a quite harrowing film called bully (i really hope no-one actually lives like that!!), eating more super noodles and finding to my absolute disgust that Mcdonalds at Southside doesn't serve beakfast on sundays (further upset came after attempting to eat 2 apple pies). I left at 6.30pm to get the bus back, quite an uneventful 2hours really.

Today was mucho oddness, almost designed to test me methinks. Work was pretty normal except some sort of demon must have been waiting at the entrance to suck all the 'happy' from me.. What ensued was a day with no motivation on my part, a crap meeting that led no-where and seemed to disregard reports i'd worked stupidly hard on (bastards), and 2 mild (i can only call them) anxiety attacks, both of which left me terrified and at one point almost suicidal in want of escape. Gah. I can only explain them as an overwhelming feeling that something was wrong and i was powerless to do anything about it.

Thankfully i calmed down before leaving (thanks liz x) and cycled merrily(ish) home until halfway through the Argall way estate I met Samantha coming the other way! Twas nice to say hello and catch up.

Argh I've written an essay!!!, sorry for making you scroll so far to skip this entry!

I saw this i Joey's LJ a few days back and thought it a nice format for a brief summary

1. What made you happy this week?
Futureheads, Eurovision, A bottle of ginger wine, discovering hackysack, spending time with people whos company i enjoy 

2. What made you sad?
Missing people online by mere minutes, if the times on e-mails are anything to go by

3. What made you angry?
McDonalds at the southside not serving breakfast on a sunday

4. What are you looking forward to in the next week?
Seeing the play, The start of my week off, getting paid, further but currently undecided things.

5. What are you not looking forward to?
Cycling to work again as i cant afford the fare!!!

You scored as Materialist. Materialism stresses the essence of fundamental particles. Everything that exists is purely physical matter and there is no special force that holds life together. You believe that anything can be explained by breaking it up into its pieces. i.e. the big picture can be understood by its smaller elements.

What is Your World View? (corrected...again)
created with QuizFarm.com
Good eh?

Went to see the jacket with mike today... actually we didnt go to see the jacket but a film about hitlers demise, which seemed to fit with my policy of gaining more knowledge. However the paper got the day wrong so we saw the jacket instead.
Wasnt bad actually but im sure reviews will be mixed on this one..

On the way back i thought about how the past weekend had gone, not for anyone else just me, and indeed about how things just seem to be looking up all round and i nearly cried. Sounds riddick but there you are

All is bright and summery in my garden at the mo, happy really just to be existing (how odd!).
Went to see someone at the new hospital today, and got to just talk about me for 90 mins, such an ego boost. 
Work was stress yesterday, having to try uber hard to do reports for a board meeting that never happened. BASTARDS!!!!
I always have more to say to this, ah well...
Yeah odd saturday night. All is good here though.

Bad ass Dave and Dean playage again last night with the production of Antigone (for some reason pronounced an-ti-gon-ey). Acting was glorious but any acting will always be over shadowed for me by a fight between a guy with a sledge-hammer and a guy with double sickles.

Went to Alans after, which was neat. As i dont think anyone that was there visits they wont appreciate me saying how cool the company was but it was all the same.

Went to the psychiatrist today, he seemed happy with my progress which is cool, but ive gotta be transfered to waltham forest now, BOOOOO!

Cant remember when i last posted, so if ive left loads out i dont care!

" The good fuck"
You are 56 fuckable!
You're about as fuckable as most people, which is not bad. Actually, it's quite healthy! You know how to act and what's appropriate. You know when it's the time and place for what. And people can use that to see you erotically. It's no surprise that you can attract a good number of people. You're what they want! A realistic babe who knows when to get a bit wild! Yeah, I'd fuck you!



My test tracked 1 variable How you compared to other people your age and gender:
You scored higher than 16% on humpers
Link: The how fuckable are you? Test written by ShizzleBitch on Ok Cupid

Really that shoulda been tiring Sunday, as in the grand old gesture for spending as little as is humanly, i stayed in most of saturday. But you know about Saturday, forgot about that.

Sunday I went to Hainault to go riding with Robbie, Dean decided to come too which was pretty neat, so we went to hollow ponds (leytonstone) and rode round for a couple of hours, which was fun. by the tome i got back to hainault i was a bit tired though i guess I musta done about 30 miles in all.
Stayed round Mum's (but you all know that) and played 2 player GTA with dean. I think I'm going over to the dark side, i found it quite fun (ARRGGHH!!!!).

Went to walthamstow library today to get a Maths textbook, i think of all the years that i didnt use textbooks and had to, now i dont and am quite enjoying it!!!
Had some good MSN's too, which was nice seeing as ive not spoken to some in a week or so

Think thats all for now. BYEEEEEE!!!!

I've decided i spend money too quickly, so this month is now an attempt to not spend, even though i have the option (albiet a limited one).
There is more to this than pure frugility (is that a real word?), as i think that i've got to learn that you dont need to spend to have a good time. It also will give me a chance to flex my cerebral metal for a bit, I want to explore my creative side (and even have an idea for a book that i quite like) and also want to learn things, which is why ive registered with the local library and borrowed three books. One on calculus, one on astrophysics and one on french. I wonder if ill get far enough into them to learn anything.
I'm gonna start looking into free entertainment too... im happy to spend a t-card but apart from that i hope to spend very little indeed. Anyone else with ideas give me a bell.

Ignore the title for a minute... 
CAD course was grand, learned loads and seemed to soak it up like a sponge. The people made it entertaining (though i recieved not one contact detail :( ) and the atmosphere was relaxed all the time.
I liked what i did and how the whole system worked and look forward to using it at work, it's gonna be cool :)

Back on topic,
I just re-read all my school reports and found myself getting a little upset/annoyed at the picture painted by them. There were only a couple of teachers who saw past my 'lack of commitment' to see a lack of confidence. But all of them showed good potential with no effort and little success. Is this what im destined to become?

You know when you get a bruise, how it feels tender when you press it. Then you leave it for a while and you think its nearly gone, but when you press it again to test it, it hurts just as bad as it ever did.

CAD course is still cool, nice and relaxed and stupidly easy, i look forward to using it in a real world environment. There is a problem though in that it just adds to the list of things i enjoy. I know its a nice problem to have, but i feel bad if i fail to pursue something i enjoy. I guess i'll just have to live with that though.

Hope all is well in the world of merriment for all. I may have said it already but good luck to those about to undertake exams

Went to see hitchhikers guide last night, found it almost too blasphemous to comprehend. If taken without the book i guess it's ok though. Mos Def is inspired as Ford Prefect and Alan Rickmans voice was perfect for Marvin. I thought the rest of the cast were too overblown or too American though (Isn't Trillian meant to be from Guildford?!?).
Then went to play DDR on a suspiciously laggy Extreme machine (I think they tried to upgrade a not quite compatible mix), which was alright, at least Maxx Unlimited was piece of piss.
Went for a drink with Rich, Law and Mike afterwards, which was a good laugh, drank a nice (and cheap), if weak cocktail called a TVR.

In other news I've started my CAD course, it all seems quite easy and long may it continue (Mike suggests i well ham it up at work though, sounds like a good idea...) and my hotmail inbox is disappointingly empty of anything but spam.

Just when you thought it was safe to hang the washing out....

Dunno why i said that, but the person to come up with a film title to match the tagline wins my respect!!

Im a bit miffed at the mo as the broadband router that would have saved me ever venturing downstairs doesnt seem to work :(. Not grand, however i did have a bit of a fun eve at Joes watching the frankly disappointing Doom 3 in progress. 

Work has turned a bit good too, with me getting a nice little raise to start the tax year and more promised should my course go well :). I know it doesnt actually change the work but if the reward is better the desire is upped slightly.

Finding that my mood is yo-yoing more than ever, hope that a solid few days on the ITG will resolve this, something has to. 

Finally in this disjointed amble, i apologise for not commenting more, just dont feel like id add to the procedings somehow. That may also have something to do with the fact ive not been around for 3 or 4 days.

Not been on since Weds so i felt the need to update...

Thursday night was blammo excellente (its not copyright do feel free to use it yourselves) first with a sucessful piece of DDRing (i now own 5 leader boards, bet that changes today...) followed by a night of grand music and merry dancing.

Problem being it was so fun i had to go to bed at 8pm yesterday to get over it (damn my silly work obligation).

Back on DDR... Those of you i havent spoken to wont know that there is an ITG tournament next saturday. I dont plan to win but i plan to enter nonetheless. Anyone interested in a day up the arcades can therefore expect me at the troc from 12pm on 30th April.

My busy weekend has become a disorganised one... i was meant to be phoning people while i was asleep last night, im sure it will all be ok.

I didn't leave an '&' out of the title. I just had a madness zone out on Stepmania. I was playing really well anyways but selected 'Mythology' quite a hard 10 with a long quarter beat stretch at the end (sorry if you are lost now). As I approached this nightmare stretch, the arrows first seemed to slow down, then acres of space appeared between each one, then finally they seemed to raise a few inches off of the screen as it was time to hit them!!!!

In case you are wondering, this isnt a hallucenogen experience, still oddness!!!!

I'm starting to hate the fact that this is a forum of badness for me, but then maybe im just concentrating on the wrong bits...

Today was (mildly) a bit odd. Work was haphazard at best, with me pulling every work avoidance trick in the book, then feeling guilty about it so apparently doing it a bit more. There was one fairly hideous half hour though where it just felt like the world was closing in on me, I just wanted to curl up into a ball and fade away. Not die necessarily just have a hiatus from life.

Met mum and dean uptown (if she doesnt update here herself ill be shocked to the core!!), and had a cool time. Had a real problem though holding on to the achievement i gleaned from my ITG freestyle attempts, or the fact i passed Utopia (another 11 making 3 so far (whats the point of shouting my successes if i dont feel successful?!)). I think im beginning to feel like its too shallow to take any credit for, although that may just be because im at the point where id have to accept credit (dammit im confused now).

Decided a couple of things on the way back. Firstly i was going to be nice to random people (and i wasn't even thinking about Danny Wallace) starting now (people looking for how that turned out skip to next paragraph). The other was a sort of desire, that is safety. I really want to be able to get home and have someone put their arms around me, and i can just stay there. I wish for nothing more than the safety of companionship, that may be even more shallow but it just feels too hard to support myself at the minute. This isn't a relationship per se either, just someone to feel comfortable with.

Ah well, with everyone thinking im shallow, we can go on to my good deeds. Nothing that special, indeed not even really deeds. One lady opposite me seemed to be nodding off, so i offered to wake her at her stop should she require. She seemed confused, (i'd simply asked where she was getting off, must've seemed a bit sus in hindsight) but on explaining she actually seemed quite pleased by the offer despite declining as like me she departed at the trains terminus. 
I also wished the Woman sitting next-but-one to me luck on her impending driving test (she was reading a theory test revision guide) and she too took it very well. I think its just gonna be women and old people for now, just because i think men get very suspicious of any offers of help in London. Unless i see a case where specific help is required.

Doesnt seem too pessimistic now does it? as always ill keep you all posted. 

BTW doesnt the indifferent smiley seem too content? i assure you its a different kind that means more to me.

You Are 19 Years Old
19
Under 12: You are a kid at heart. You still have an optimistic life view - and you look at the world with awe. 13-19: You are a teenager at heart. You question authority and are still trying to find your place in this world. 20-29: You are a twentysomething at heart. You feel excited about what's to come... love, work, and new experiences. 30-39: You are a thirtysomething at heart. You've had a taste of success and true love, but you want more! 40+: You are a mature adult. You've been through most of the ups and downs of life already. Now you get to sit back and relax.
What Age Do You Act?
Not really surprised, oh well. Bet i woulda come out a lot older a year or so ago, however it is a very optimistic take on life. Where's the '20's - rotting in a bedsit with a needle in your arm, waiting for the end to come'? Glad to hear that OK Computer was voted the greatest album of all time. Not sure i agree, but radiohead deserve the acclaim in every form.

Feeling almost as bad as i ever have if im honest. This is a real shame as ive just remembered that Saturday was a really cool day. I really wish the good times stuck but they just wash away. Imagine if you will a velcro pad. I am that pad, all good feelings are rocks and all bad feelings are scatch balls (early 90's reference anyone?). So give me a good day with a bad minute and all you get is a bad day.

This isnt to depress anyone, just trying to slightly explain my absurd fluctuations in mood that some of you may experience from me. Im sometimes happy, exceptionally happy. It must seem like nothing can bring me down, but somehow it does. I quote two parties in the early part of the year. Jo and Law's birthdays both started well and Im sure i seemed to be loving it, indeed i was. One knock however, not necessarily caused by anyone just one that exists, is enough for me to quit with any sort of joy. 

I dont know why,  i wish it wasnt the way but alas it is. One thing is however, i am pursuing help. It does appear to be a psychological disorder of some kind, and after some time putting it off, im going to get anti-depressants from the pharmacy (not in some insane heist, they are perscribed) and im really gonna try. Until i see some sort of therapist though, im not sure what trying is. I just hope that all of you keep your patience with me long enough to see me when i feel like its ok to be me.

Also a little apology to all that ive been 'off' with at some point for about the last year/18 months. It may have been a genuine gripe at the time, but im sure however it was i acted, it was entirely disproportionate. 

Thanks to everyone thats there for me, however it seems to come across, i appreciate it now, and will probably appreciate it a lot more at some point in the (hopefully) not too distant future. Although my overriding mood is depressed, there is a hint of optimism bourne of this post so take that in too.

I dislike having rants metres high piled up inside me just to have to be restrained and pleasant because the situation calls for it. I hate lots of things. I want to reply 'so am i'. to a post. I want to crawl under a log and wait for the wolves to get me. I want to be able to just do the hell i want. I hate having to take other people into consideration. I hate feeling bad for having bad feelings. I hate people that sympathise if they dont want to/cant empathise. I wish i could go back and change things. i wish i could go further back and change other things. I wish i could go even further back and change even more things. I wish changing things wasnt an issue.
I wish i saw greyscale rather then black and white. I hope im gonna be ok. I hope ill never be ok. I hope you are all alright. I hope you are all suffering. I wish i could make my mind up. I wish i had so much money, just getting up and going to london wouldnt cause a problem. I hate worrying about money. I hate worrying about work. I hate feeling unsettled. I hate being still for too long. I wish i had something to cling to or at least take my mind off of life. I wish i didnt have to go to work tomorrow. I wish more than one person ever found my live journal worthy of comment. I wish this hadnt turned into a wishlist.

Bollocks, bollocks, bollocks
this is all bollocks
so there
so fucking there

Messenger has for the second time in a week locked me out for no obvious reason. I dont know why or if it affects anyone else but i get a temporarily unavailable notice and it logs me off. The word, I think you'll all agree is 'BASTARDS!!!!'. Apologies to those that i was speaking to, i will try and talk again later if you are still on (although i know you will be Richard. Ermmm, a generally disappointing day really, i just wasnt feeling it. Just as it started to pick up through talking to people and therefore relaxing a bit, they booted me. Hmmmm... Ive been alright of late, though phenomenally undermotivated. Just want to do loads, but cant be arsed... How sick I am of the paradox that is me. Well on the plus side MSN is working again, christ knows for how long

Hello all,
Not much to say as I've been at work all day. For that I am tired. For cycling there and back, I am more so.
Hope all is well in the spinny world of people, i will say more when i have more to say!!!

Honestly, I'm not sure whats going on right now... I had, by all accounts a reasonable weekend. Just something didn't make it feel quite right. It's not like i felt this way for the duration, just recently. 

Well for a moderate update, the aforementioned event at Judes was alright. Towards the end (especially when just Charlie and partner (Darryl or Darren, I didn't ask for accuracy, I never do...) I just didn't feel, well wanted i guess... Almost like i was exhausting oxygen for the others. I had however had a fabulous time during the day just chilling at Mums, just playing cards etc.

Today was cool too, if not slightly forced at times. It was very nice talking to Maggie and Roger at Jo's, as it always is, and it was about the sixth time I said goodbye to Jo before she returned to Wandsworth. Was also cool playing cards at the Murcutt's. See I had a good time today but cant help but feel slightly weird about the whole affair.

Without tainting events, i guess I feel slightly disheartened that the first real event at the flat has occurred without me. Even though I knew it must happen. Guess I just didn't really think about it so once more wasn't really sure how to deal with it.

Went to Mike's in the evening and got some talking done, which helped to clarify things in some small way. I guess thats all part of life though, the good moods cannot last forever, just have to enjoy them while they last.

A 36 hour waking day to be precise. That is a day that should have left me more tired than it appears to have... 

Work was excellent, lots of people making sure i was ok etc. lots enquiring as to why i was away so long. Everyone was very nice and a few people that i wasn't even sure if they noticed me before were calling me over to make sure i was alright and catch up.

The bike proved to be a monster to ride. I found myself putting my foot down in far too many places as the breaks just werent cutting it. That and i got a little lost getting to Leytonstone in the afternoon so it took me about 10 minutes longer than it should have.

I was in Leytonstone to see Mr K and it had the wonderful effect of making me feel like i was 16 again... From eating Pizza on Demand, Chatting to the Knights as a whole and meeting Chris J near Tescos. Like I've never been away...

nice to hear from all the people that want to see hitchhikers guide. As I speak to all of you all the time... Ill arrange it with you a bit closer to the time (though first week of May seems good).

I (as you may have guessed) have been up all night. Talking away to darryl about Eienstiens theory of Relativity (of course!). When an idea occured to me, namely:

Should an object ever remain completely stationary for any length of time, it would immediately cease to exist.

Before you all comment that you are sitting perfectly still, i will remind you that the earth is spinning on its axis, as well as round the sun. Which in turn is going round the centre of the galaxy, which is moving away from the centre of the universe. 

just thought you'd like to know that.

Went to collect my bike from Liz's today, which was far from unpleasant. The bike itself, however was a fair distance from pleasant, one wheel is buckled and the brakes dont quite work but it goes, which is the important thing.

Work starts later on today (as it is technically Friday now). I may have to stay up all night to reset my body clock, especially as its nudging one now. Got a long cycle ahead of me soon, but i will not mind as i wont be at work for too long.

As it occurs to me... Im really looking forward to 'The Hitchhikers guide to the galaxy' movie... Who wants to come and see it next month?

erm... thats all i think. ill tell all about work later on today.

I went and played dance dance today! I know you dont much want to hear it, but you have no choice, so here are the highlights...
Passed Disconnected Hyper (Hard - 9) with a score of 91.2% (S-) to come first on the leader board
Passed Hybrid (expert - 10) with a score of 77.3% (B) to come fifth on the leader board
Passed July (expert - 11) with a score so rubbish i cant remember, but its my first 11!! W00T to me!!!

ok DDR ramble finished... I have either the start or the end of a cold (i may have slept through the worst but i really cant tell), so that isnt cool but meh to that. 

Was gonna do a deep and meaningful on everyone, but to be honest i just dont feel like it now (despite the mereness of this post it took 20 mins to write). Hope all are having good times and whippy ice cream. Im off to look at the weather to see if richard was being barmy when he said it was gonna snow soon!!!

Guess what im going to be doing today... dunno where it's all going to go. The room im in is a 6 foot square with a bed in it (not that im in currently, the one i sleep in). 2 great big black bin bags of dirty clothes, sort of gives me reason to keep up with the washing from now on. Never know when you may need to transport things.

Christ its cold in here. Ive only just turned on the heating. 

Back to work Friday and i'm only half looking forward to it. It will be nice to have something to occupy me but not so nice to have something i have to do. The idea of freedom is very alluring right now. Right I'm gonna go and put on a Jumper or two.

This is firmly in the realms of the abysmal. Will anything ever happen to lighten my mood for more than an hour or so. That riddick test claimed i was a hedonist, but i see no evidence of things that make me feel good, although i guess my self launching into absurd amounts of london goage is an attempt at the above.

Hello again by the way. it has just occurred to me that i returned to the LJ scene yesterday with a curious post despite the fact ive been quiet for 10 weeks. Some blogger i am. 

2005.... i think the title says it all. heres to starting the new year next year, i may just be ready for it then.

Both the previous table and these traits came out of the simpleminds test, that someone (i've forgotten who) posted results of recently:

paranoid tendencies, irritable, anxious, fidgety, dependent, worrying, emotionally sensitive, prone to regret, depressed, second guesses self, somewhat fragile, dislikes change, prefers organized to unpredictable, suspicious, phobic, craves attention, not a risk taker, low self control, very sensitive to criticism, unadventurous, does not make friends easily, defensive, obsessive, low self esteem 

Hardly a magnificent read is it?

Well but nothing really, i havent posted for a while as i havent much to say, im emotionally stable. Liz is feeling a lot better and im looking forward to tomorrow. (twas grand last time :) ).
work is going surprisingly well, seems like if you try and throw everything up in the air at once it doesnt land too far from where it started.
Hope everyone is cool and the like

Right, another update... I feel like a true blogger.

First, Liz's condition. 
On Monday night (about 6pm) she had an ultrasound scan, which showed no obstructions in the bile ducts (those studying biology can tell me the real name), this meant that whatever obstruction caused the condition, it's not there anymore.

Today on meeting the consultant, Liz was told that they (all going well) will operate on her on Tuesday to remove the Gall bladder (the little bastard that caused all this). As a result she will be staying in for observation till Friday, then put on weekend release till Monday. All this means that shes still in some pain (though nowhere near as bad) and it should all soon be over.

Thank you all for your kind words, they mean a lot to both of us. Thankfully today has been a lot easier, Liz calling me early on to put my mind at rest, so i could get on with just doing the normal old thing. Still feel a bit like a yo - yo right now but im sure that will improve. Also with Liz being better (ish) but still in hospital, i can stay here with a lighter heart. 

Will obviously keep you all posted. Oh and im sometimes on MSN  edicius81@hotmail.com, you may add me if you so wish, (makes it so much easier than hunting all your adresses down).
BYEEEEE!!

erm... help.
This was intended to be a bit of a foray into my feelings, but then i realised that other people read it and didn't feel to... Then i Realised that the fact other people read it is the reason im not writing on paper... See sad as it sounds (and vividly self important), i like getting a response from my feelings, otherwise im just not sure what they mean. anyway if it gets too much write "oh yes i see what you mean" as a comment now. That will keep us both satisfied, done it yet? good.

For those of you that are still here, read the most recent post from Lizbag, I know it's not from 'her' exactly but you know...

Right so now i'm going back in time one week, as it was almost that to the minute that we decided to stop being "Waine and Liz", and take up being "Waine" and "Liz". I'm not sure that any decision i've made thus far as played as hard on my mind as that. Liz is being her usual strong self, any sign of outward weakness wouldn't do, although I can see it's as hard for her as it is for me. As for me, I've been an emotional state, useless at hiding my true feelings without being an arse, up until Friday morning I'd either been crying or an arse at any one point. There were the high points though... Tuesday night was glorious, so good that i ruined it when we got in, was horrible on wednesday and quite nice on Thursday, me having just been round Mike's for a more than useful chat, however on thursday night Liz got a text that however misinterpreted, meant that someone close had been thoughtless (sorry i'm so vague but it's more feelings than events im trying to explore). 

I went crazy, smashed things, shouted a lot and mainly threw up all the emotion i'd been harbouring since Monday. Sort of "i wish we could be together," "Why the hell can't we be together," and "now i've thought about it being single is probably a good idea" had been going round on a carousel and i couldn't take any more confusion.

Friday and Saturday were brilliant cause I started to feel close to Liz without the need to be with her (after all that Yo-Yo ing it was either that or start my career as a quivering wreck sooner than planned). and also arranged between us and Samantha that i would stay round there while she was in Scotland, giving us the opportunity to be realy alone for a few days in order to adjust.

Meanwhile i'd been coming to the conclusion that my job was paying me less than i needed to do more than i wanted and am still intending on handing in my notice on Tuesday.

The events of today though have left me lost again, I know that being single is right for both of us, but seeing Liz in hospital today, all i wanted to do was make her happy, and not by being her flatmate. Thing is i'll probably be OK after sleep, but at the moment so much is going on in my little mind i feel ready to burst. if anyone wants to be showered in brains, now would be a good time to stand close.

As I've said, I'll keep you posted on Liz's condition when i know more, but due to the recent events i'll be at the normal place this week for those of you who may wish to contact me.
now i must go, as my bicycle is beginning to beckon...

The meal was actually quite fun (wouldya believe it!) so there!

ermmm... Richard says hello, and the pilchard protesters are out in force (bastards).

i don't know why i logged on really, ohhhh.. i know it's cause i know what PC i want, the money is on its way to my credit card and la de do di ay wah hoo. 

ill keep you all posted on that, and the squeaky door too.

if this didn't make any sense i'm sorry but i'm not sure it was meant to.

Did anyone check the layout when they coded this ballsy site?! (hold on news just in... it's actually my ballsy PC, oh well as long as i can moan...)
Well Liz is getting ready for dinner for my dad's birthday. I of course am waiting till it's far too late for me to do all the things i'd like to before it's time to leave. 
It's kinda cool to make one entry and then find that everyone but everyone considers you a friend, hope you like the name and dont find it too environmentally offensive, I assure you the Pilchard died of natural poisoning from toxins spewed by a Barnsley factory.

In order to finish on a completely wasted note (like the ones previous i guess), go and see saw. not because its grand but because i think its gonna split the audience. Of course that is the real point of going to the cinema, to have an opinion.

Bye!!!!

not much happened today so ill tell what i would have liked to have happened.
At 9am i awoke to find the cat eating a wasp, glad to have avoided any potential sting based damage i danced my way to the lounge to the tune of 'stairway to heaven' my very own dance remix. Having reached the lounge i fell asleep on the sofa until about 5 mins ago. so there you are hope you like my live journal, this will be one of few entries im sure.

goodbye.
